benchmark_details.name: TTS-Uniform (Test-Time Scaling Framework)
benchmark_details.overview: TTS-Uniform is a framework designed to mitigate the selection bias of reasoning strategies in large language models (LLMs) when applying test-time scaling. It aims to enhance the effectiveness of scaling by uniformly allocating the sampling budget across diverse reasoning strategies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To propose a framework that can improve the performance of LLMs by addressing strategy-selection bias in chain-of-thought reasoning during test-time scaling.

data.source: Experimental results validated on reasoning benchmarks with diverse task complexities.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the number of correct responses across sampled paths and the defined metrics from benchmark datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and Pass@k values indicate better performance of the proposed TTS-Uniform framework.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance comparisons with baseline methods like Self-Consistency and other test-time scaling methods.
methodology.validation: Validation through extensive experiments on multiple reasoning benchmarks.
